main event: A civilian observed an unusual light in the sky for about 30 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as star-like, silver in color, and moving slower than two aircraft that were also observed.
The object was first noticed directly overhead and then faded to the east-southeast above the horizon.
The observer was a civilian, aged 23, and considered a reliable source by the preparing officer.
The weather conditions were clear with unlimited ceiling and good visibility at the time of the sighting.
The preparing officer believed the sighting was likely an observation of a high-altitude, cross-country flight or an echo 3 (a type of radar return).
result: Celestial - Probably a high flying aircraft or satellite.
sighted object: A star-like, silver object in the sky
